summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2019 discussing the creation of a public victim questionnaire and webpage for the Epstein case. It involves coordination between FBI personnel in New York and the FBI Victim Services Division to gather information from potential victims.

persons.name: Spwatson
persons.role: FBI Victim Services Division Unit Chief
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the forwarded email providing guidance on creating a victim questionnaire and webpage for the Epstein case.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein Victim Questionnaire
events.description: Internal FBI email discussion about creating a public victim questionnaire and webpage for the Epstein case to gather information from potential victims.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking to identify additional victims in the Epstein case as of July 2019.
The FBI Victim Services Division was involved in creating a public-facing questionnaire and webpage for the Epstein investigation.
The plan included creating a dedicated FBI email address (e.g., xxxxxxxxVictims@fbi.gov) for victims to submit information.
The questionnaire was intended to gather basic victim information to help agents prioritize interviews.
The document shows coordination between FBI personnel in New York and the FBI's Victim Services Division.
